basics.name: Pablo García Rius
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a versatile Software Engineer with a passion for building impactful digital solutions. With experience spanning full-stack development and Data Analysis, I bring a product-focused mindset to every project. My background includes working international teams in large organizations, where I’ve delivered high-performance applications, optimized workflows, and automated complex processes. I am always eager to explore new technologies and solve challenging problems that create meaningful value.

certificates.name: PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer
certificates.summary: Demonstrates foundational knowledge of Python programming concepts, including syntax, data structures, functions, and error handling.

education.summary: Focused on software engineering, project management, and data connectivity. Dissertation project recognized for creating a linked open data dataset and an interactive map visualization tool for socio-economic analysis in Madrid.
highlights: Developed a linked open data dataset for Madrid municipalities' socioeconomic data, creating custom economic indicators and an interactive map using React and OpenLayers.
Scored 9.1 on dissertation project and received recognition from 'LODCoreMadrid' chair.
Led and delivered software projects using AGILE methodology, from requirements gathering to documentation.
Designed and managed relational and non-relational databases, building server-side applications with Spring (Java), Flask (Python), and Node.js.

education.summary: 6-month exchange program focusing on full-stack development and cloud computing. Worked in a team environment to build scalable applications and enhance technical and interpersonal skills.
highlights: Led a 6-member international team on a full-stack application project, developing a frontend with Angular and a REST API service in Flask for e-invoice management.
Gained hands-on experience with AWS, deploying and maintaining applications using services like EBS, RDS, and Lambda.
Strengthened conflict-resolution and communication skills while working in a multicultural environment.

awards.title: LODCoreMadrid Chair 2nd Award
awards.summary: Recognized for outstanding contributions to the development of a linked open data dataset for Madrid municipalities, which enhanced socio-economic data analysis and connectivity. The interactive map created for the project received special commendation.

work.name: TK Elevators
work.summary: Contributed to data-driven decision-making and operational improvements through advanced data analysis and reporting tools.

work.name: NTT Data Europe & Latam
work.summary: Worked on full-stack development projects, streamlining sensor data processing and enhancing data visualization capabilities.

projects.name: Resume JSON Version
projects.description: A personal resume built using Astro, showcasing a lightweight and optimized approach for web and PDF formats. The project emphasizes simplicity, modern web development practices, and scalability.
